column1: (M) NOTE: THE HARD COPY OF THIS SCRIPT CONTAINED SCENE NUMBERS AND SOME "SCENE OMITTED" SLUGS. THEY HAVE BEEN REMOVED FOR THIS SOFT COPY.
(N) We're in a large closet. JACK KIEFER, an athletic American in his late thirties wearing a headset, is wedged into a corner, staring at a television screen.

(N) The television shows a surveillance view of the living room that lies outside the confines of the closet. The TV image is in black and white. JACK shifts, trying like hell to get comfortable but he's been there a while

(N) A bare bulb shines down on the contents of a shabby hotel room. Directly under the blub a man, GENNADY KASIMOV, sits in a straight backed wooden chair in his blood-stained T- shirt. There are a couple of THUGS and a stray HOOKER in the room behind him. A legend:

(N) KASIMOV is sobbing. Uncontrollably. A MAN enters the room, ANATOLY, an imperious Russian in his forties, a Russian godfather. The THUGS and HOOKERS are ushered out. ANATOLY looks down at KASIMOV pitiously and urges him to go and sit by him in a chair he picks up for him. KASIMOV does as he is bid, looking gratefully up at ANATOLY. They speak in Russian which is subtitled.
(D) Kasimov, Kasimov, good that you called us.
(D) (M) (sobbing) I don't remember what happened! We were at the bar, drinking, laughing -- having fun.

(N) ANATOLY gets up out of the chair and goes to a bed across the room. A WOMAN lies half under the sheets. She's lying in an unnatural position on the bed, and the sheets are smeared with blood. She's dead. ANATOLY lifts her eyelid.
(D) I don't even know how I got here. I swear, Anatoly, I never touched her! I didn't lay a finger on her.
(N) ANATOLY moves away from the WOMAN.
(D) Jesus, she's been under too long. Come on, come on!
(D) You're the only one who can help me.
(N) Desperately he tugs at ANATOLY'S jacket. But ANATOLY hits his hand away and smacks him around the head.
(N) ANATOLY paces up the room, away from KASIMOV.
(D) You asked for my help. You asked for my help...come on...
(D) The name pal...give us the name.
(D) The contact in Minsk..the contact in Minsk..works in a travel agency.
(N) Back on screen, ANATOLY places a hand on KASIMOV'S shoulder as if he had just anointed him.
(N) In the closet, JACK types the name into a computer and cross checks -- "MIEDIEV" comes up, then "posting/American consulate/Kiev."
(N) JACK turns and nods to a WHOREHOUSE WAITRESS in costume in the closet next to him, dressed in traditional Russian tunic and virtually no bottom. She quickly leaves.
(N) We enter the room for the first time as the WAITRESS does. She's carrying a tray with a bottle of vodka and two shot glasses.
(N) He pours them out and hands one to KASIMOV.
(N) He drinks. He blinks. Something felt funny about that. Dizzied, KASIMOV swoons and passes out on the floor. ANATOLY moves to the closet door and opens it.
(N) ANATOLY reaches up to his face --
(D) (M) (in English now) Get rid of this scum.

(N) ETHAN goes quickly to the body of the dead woman. He cheeks the pulse in her neck, shines a penlight in her eye. He strips the adrenalin kit and jabs the long needle into the dead woman's thigh. He checks her pulse again, checking a stopwatch. In about ten seconds, the woman's eyes open.
(N) CLAIRE is her name, a French woman of thirty or so. She half rolls over, GROANS, and wipes some of the blood from her mouth.
(D) We got it. On your feet.
(D) I want to sleep. Can I sleep here.
(N) JACK comes into the room from the closet. He hands CLAIRE her jewelry, including a watch and a wedding ring. ETHAN stops what he's doing, noticing. She looks up at him questioningly.
(D) Are you all right Ethan. What's wrong with you?
(D) If you're gonna do this again Claire, It's not gonna be on my watch.
(N) JACK comes into the room from the closet. He hands CLAIRE her jewelry, including a watch and a wedding ring. ETHAN stops what he's doing, noticing. She looks up at him, questioningly.
(N) She almost unconsciously slips the wedding ring onto her finger. ETHAN notices. He turns and SHOUTS to the room at large.
(D) IS THERE ANY PARTICULAR REASON WE'RE NOT OUT OF HERE YET?!
(N) He walks across the room and out the door. CLAIRE, worried, clutches her hands together, glancing down at her wedding ring.
(N) The pilot's voice makes an announcement.
(D) Ladies and gentlemen, we have leveled off at our cruising altitude of thirty-eight thousand feet-and we should be arriving in Prague right on schedule.
(D) Would you like to watch a movie Mr Rosen?
(N) A passenger takes one. The ATTENDANT continues on.
(D) (M) (CONT'D) Would you like to watch a movie Mr Phelps?
(N) A look crosses the FLIGHT ATTENDANT'S face; her tone becomes stilted.
(D) Would you consider the cinema of the Ukraine?
(D) Perhaps you'd choose one for me.
(M) AT THE FRONT OF THE CABIN.

(N) PHELPS reaches down and turns a lever on the support between his seat and the empty one beside him. He flips up a small movie screen and angles it toward himself, away from the other passengers. He puts on a headset, opens a door in the armrest, and puts the tape in.

(N) the image of a man comes on. EUGENE KITTRIDGE is fortyish, but seems permanently stuck in the Nixon era -- horn rimmed glasses, short short haircut, rather be caught dead than tieless. But if he catches your eye, he will never, ever look away. He's seated at a desk, looking into the camera.
(D) (M) (on the tape) Good morning, Mr. Phelps. The man you're about to see is Aleksander Golitsyn --
(N) The screen winks and shows an image of GOLITSYN, a burly man in his forties. The image is herky-jerky videotape, presumably taken from a concealed camera as GOLITSYN walks down a foreign street.

(D) -- a former KGB Line X officer now working the international black market selling intelligence. This morning, we learned that Golitsyn has stolen one half of a CIA NOC list, the list of our non- official cover agents working in Eastern Europe.
(N) The screen shows an image of what such a list might look like, code names and other information scrolling by on a computer screen at high speed.

(D) For security reasons, the NOC list is divided into two encoded halves. Golitsyn already has the cryptonym portion, which contains agent code names and targeting areas. This portion is useless unless combined with the second half -- the true name list that is kept in the CIA station in our Embassy in Prague.

(D) We believe Golitsyn plans to steal the true name list at an Embassy function tomorrow night. Your mission, should you decide to accept it, is to obtain photographic proof of the theft, apprehend those involved, and return the stolen list. I don't have to stress the importance of this matter, Jim. We're keeping it internally black. Because of its urgency, I've already sent to Prague a team selected from your usual group.
(N) Still photographs come on screen, some of which we're already seen -- JACK KIEFER, CLAIRE and ETHAN.
(D) Ethan Hunt will of course be your point man, as usual. He's in Kiev; we're getting word to him now.
(N) PHELPS sits back in his seat, closes his eyes, and rubs his tired brow. KITTRIDGE himself comes back on the tape.
(D) As always, should you or any member of your IM force be caught or killed, the Secretary will disavow all knowledge of your actions. This tape will self- destruct in five seconds. Good luck, Jim!
(N) SARAH and HANNA, a German woman in her mid-thirties enter. Another legend:
(D) Look to your right, then back to me. There's a camera built right into the bridge. Whatever you see it sees and transmits it back here. Can you hear me?
(D) Of course I can hear you.
(D) No, in your...ear piece. You have a lovely smile (M) (eyes). Can you hear me now?
(D) Why don't you take a look?
(D) That's what we do isn't it?
(D) Too wicked to have a drink later?
(D) I think I might just take that look.
(N) ETHAN and JIM PHELPS are in a heated conversation.
(D) Yeah, well, Jim, fact is I've got more than ninety days leave coming.
(D) A hundred and sixty-seven, I think it is. Take it all, if you want. After this one.
(D) I thought I'd take some now.
(D) (M) (quietly, to Ethan) What the hell's made you decide to take your leave at the worst possible time? Claire's in a weird mood too.
(D) I don't know, I had to go to Chicago again. You were in Kiev. You tell me.
(D) When you started noticing your short term memory loss. What the problem was you and Claire had in Kiev?
(D) (M) (laughs) Ah, God, forget it. What are we talking burnout here?
(D) Because I can't afford it. And because you'd burn up before you'd burn out.

(D) Wonderful. Ran into a convention of auto dealers at the Drake Hotel. You hear the one about the astronaut who comes back from the first manned flight to Mars after two years? His wife's got a year old kid. So he says "All right. Who was it? My friend Harry?" She says no. "Oh, it was my friend Sammy." She says it wasn't Sammy. "Oh, I suppose it was my friend Lou." "No, what's the matter, don't you think I have any friends of my own?!"
(N) PHELPS laughs. ETHAN doesn't. The back of CLAIRE'S head is in his line of sight.
(D) Boy, you really are grim. Come here, take a look.
(N) He leads ETHAN to the window, which overlooks the city.

(D) Beyond Charles Bridge there is our Embassy. See it? Tomorrow night, if anything goes wrong, this guy will steal the names of our agents in every country all over Eastern Europe. Up for grabs to the highest bidders -- third world terrorists, arms dealers, drug lords -- any and everybody who'd love to get rid of long term coverts like us, and some very dear friends among them. If they're exposed, they'll be executed. Come over here. Take a lock at this.

(D) I'll go you one further. I say the CIA and all its shadow organizations have become irrelevant at best and unconstitutional at worst. It's time we throw a little light on the whole concept of the Pentagon's "black budget." These covert agency subgroups have confidential funding, they report to no one -- who are these people?! We were living in a democracy the last time I checked.
(D) Isn't he chairing the Armed Services hearing?
(D) Not this week. This week he's flyfishing at the Oughterard Slough in County Kildare, with one of our best Irish guides.
(D) He won't be back in a hurry?
(D) No, not in a hurry. What do you think? You think the plot'll work?
(D) Sure. If the main character does.
(D) If you were me, Ethan, who would you trust to make him believable?
(N) JACK comes breezing in with a piece of bubble gum.
(N) JACK shows the gum to ETHAN.
(D) Stick of gum. If you come up against a lock you can't pick --
(N) Half the gum is red, the other half is green.
(D) Red light. Green light. Mash them together, asta lasagna. Don't get any on you -- you have five seconds.
(N) He offers the gum to ETHAN.
(N) CLAIRE glances up from the computer and catches ETHAN's eye. PHELPS may have caught the glance, but is focused on ETHAN.
(D) (M) (relenting) Give me the God damn gum.

(N) PHELPS is at a table in the safe house apartment, watching the bank of monitors HANNAH wired together earlier. The monitors are alive now, showing various views of the inside of the Embassy, where the party is going on, and one view of the elevator shaft.
(N) PHELPS wearing an IMF headset and speaks into the mouthpiece.
(D) Ethan. Jack's inside. Window's open by twenty-three hundred.
(N) Inside the Embassy, the party is a formal, tuxedoed affair that's in full swing on the second floor.
(D) How do you do, Senator, I'm Rand Housman, the Ambassador's aide. If I could just steer you through the reception line here --
(D) Allow me to introduce Jaroslav Reid, the director of the National Gallery -- Petr Brandl, the mayor of Prague --
(D) I bet you don't remember me, do you, Senator?
(D) Of course I do. How are you, Miss Norman?
(N) He leans in and kisses her on the cheek, and as he does so SARAH whispers something in his ear.
(D) He's in pocket. Under the archway behind me.
(N) Her tone, her words -- we realize she's on the team.
(M) UNDER AN ARCHWAY NEAR THE ENTRANCE,
(N) PHELPS sees the SENATOR's point of view of GOLITSYN, through the glasses, broadcast back to PHELPS' monitor. He speaks into his microphone.
(D) Sarah, mark the package and go to two.
(N) SARAH still has the SENATOR's attention.
(D) Your advance team mentioned you'd want a tour of the facility, so I've gone ahead and set that up for you --
(D) Terrific. Let's get going. (M) (to the Diplomat) Will you excuse us?
(N) He slips an arm around SARAH and they walk off, not into the party, but the other way, toward a staircase that leads further into the Embassy.
(N) JACK climbs up the elevator shaft, towards the gray metal box. He just begins to remove the cover when he hears a noise from above. He looks up and sees the elevator above him descending.
(N) JACK quickly pulls himself flush against the wall. The elevator comes down adjacent to him and stops, pinning him to the wall.

(N) As the SENATOR and SARAH pass behind the entering GOLITSYN, SARAH pulls a small bottle of perfume from her purse. But as she sprays, she points it slightly to the left, missing herself and hitting the back of GOLITSYN'S head. He never notices. They move on and down the flight of stairs.
(N) On a flight of stairs, HANNAH, dressed for the party and slightly out of breath, hurries up the stairs.
(N) She also has a pair of Visco glasses, which she trains on the party below. She pushes a micro switch on the side of her glasses, activating an electronic filter, which tints the lenses.
(D) Hannah, pull the shade (M) (or - Hannah go to night vision).
(N) the party looks the same, but one head in the crowd stands out. That head is GOLITSYN'S, his hair a fluorescent green where SARAH sprayed it.
(S) INT. THE DENIED AREA/ELEVATOR BANK - NIGHT
(N) He nods to SARAH, they round a corner, and come to an elevator at the end of the corridor. A sign in front of it says "Out of Order." They head for it anyway.
(D) Governor's in position. We have the elevator.
(D) Excuse me, can I help you?
(D) -- which leads directly to the Denied Area, the only limited access area in the whole facility.
(N) SARAH flashes an ID at the GUARD and keeps talking.
(D) As you can see. this area has both a Marine guard and video surveillance, and is strictly monitored at all times.
(N) She walks up to the thumbprint analyzer on the elevator bank and slides her thumb inside. The panel lights up and flashes a message -- "ACCESS DENIED." SARAH and ETHAN trade a look.
(D) (M) (covering) Senator, don't you have a young man on your staff named JACK?
(N) She tries the thumb again, Still no soap.
(D) Jack? I believe we did have a young man named Jack. Not a reliable man, as I recall. Constantly late or behind in his work.
(N) Now the GUARD, noticing that Sarah's not being allowed access, comes closer to them.
(D) Excuse me, let me see that ID again!
(N) JACK is still pinned to the wall by the elevator, listening to their conversation.
(D) Jack's pinned down Sarah. Should be a second. Keep dancing.
(D) (M) (with the Senator's southern accent) We were forced to tie him to my best stallion and drag him around the barn a few times.
(D) Relax your crack, Foghorn, I'm workin' on it.
(N) He quickly opens the gray metal box, revealing a maze of circuitry. He patches in his computer, climbs on top of the elevator, and hits the keyboard, beginning to download.
(N) there's a split-screen of SARAH's thumbprint and the ID picture. JACK downloads her file into the security computer.
(S) INT. THE DENIED AREA/ELEVATOR BANK - NIGHT
(N) Ignoring the GUARD, SARAH turns and slides her thumb into the thumbprint analyzer once more. The panel glows, this time the message flashes --
(N) He snaps a salute. ETHAN and SARAH get into the elevator and the doors close behind them.
(N) JACK looks down at the elevator below. Through a grating, he can see them inside.
(D) The drink (M) (date) with Sarah is definitely off.
(N) PHELPS moves from JACK's view of the elevator car to HANNAH's view of the party on his video monitors.
(D) (M) (a touch of impatience) Hannah -- I'm blind again. Hannah.
(D) He's heading to the denied area.

(N) This work room is filled with combination lock filing cabinets and various computer terminals. ETHAN hands SARAH his Visco glasses and she crosses the room, placing them upside down on top of a filing cabinet.
(N) ETHAN straps on a Visco wrist monitor and tunes it in, switching several times.
(N) the view of the main computer terminal is upside down, but clear. Anyone sitting there will be recorded.
(D) Get moving, Ethan. He's rolling to you.
(N) ETHAN pushes the elevator button but the elevator is already moving up.

(N) In a split view, we see both sides of the elevator wall simultaneously -- on one side, JACK is lying on top of the rising elevator, on the other side, ETHAN and SARAH are waiting for it to arrive.
(N) The elevator stops, the doors open --
(N) PHELPS sees JACK's point of view of the elevator, with GOLITSYN inside.
(D) (M) (tension rising) He's in the box, Ethan, he's in the box!
(N) ETHAN and SARAH are waiting in front of the elevator, the one GOLITSYN is about to step off of! ETHAN looks around, for a place to hide.
(D) OK. Taking Golitsyn's exit. Jack, open the doors.
(D) What about my coat? I'll freeze.
(N) PHELPS whips over to a laptop and starts typing.
(N) He jabs ENTER on his keyboard.
(N) The elevator doors WHISK open, revealing the empty shaft beyond. ETHAN and SARAH jump into the shaft.

(N) ETHAN and SARAH jump down into the five foot empty space below the work room floor. Above them, the elevator continues its descent, with them hiding below. The elevator drops to just over their heads and stops.

(N) GOLITSYN steps off the elevator, crosses the room and slides a 3.5 computer disk into the computer in the work room. Through the Visco glasses, we can clearly see him at work, downloading the vital information.
(N) Waiting below the elevator, ETHAN takes off his jacket, starting to reverse it. He checks his Visco wrist monitor as GOLITSYN perpetrates the theft. He smiles and speaks into a microphone.
(D) He's got it. Saved your ass again Jack.
(D) Sarah's reconsidering. Claire, transport in five minutes.
(N) Back inside, ETHAN strips off his mask and wearing his now reversed jacket, he and SARAH exit the small door at the base of the elevator shaft.
(N) JACK rapidly disconnects his equipment. But as he pulls the final electrical clip from the elevator's wiring, it flashes and SPARKS.
(N) ETHAN and SARAH exit an Embassy service area by the waterfront and blend into the Embassy crowd, as an amorous couple.
(D) In position. Jack open the door, let the package roll.
(D) Stairway, youÃ­re wrapped, go to transport.
(N) HANNAH breaks off and goes up the stairs.
(N) The button marked "ROOF" lights up, seemingly all by itself.
(N) The car engages with a sharp jolt --
(N) On one of his monitors, PHELPS sees the elevator moving in the shaft.
(D) IÃ­m not doing anything! (M) (I donÃ­t have it either).
(N) PHELPS is typing at his keyboard and jamming the enter button but gets no response.
(D) I donÃ­t have it -- I donÃ­t have control!
(D) Uh -- then I have a problem.
(N) GOLITSYN pulls out the now-programmed disk from the computer, slips it in his jacket pocket and heads for the door.
(N) JACK looks up through his Visco glasses at the approaching roof, covered with spikes.
(N) Through the monitor, ETHAN sees JACKÃ­S P.O.V. of the roof of the building approaching. Fast.
(D) Cut the power. Cut the power Jack. Do you hear me.
(N) On top of the elevator, JACK has ripped open the control panel again and is frantically trying to adjust wires to get the thing to stop.
(N) He swears, his fingers fumble, he works faster and faster. He looks up. The roof of the building is nearly upon him. ETHAN (O.S.) Come on, Jack, come on.
(N) JACK looks up again, he cringes, he covers his head with his hands, he SCREAMS --
(N) ETHAN is staring at the static on the monitor that once was JACKÃ­S signal.
(N) He closes his eyes, knowing what that means.
(D) Man down. Stay where you are. IÃ­m on my way.
(N) He gets up and races out of the apartment.
(N) He hits the floor of the elevator shaft and exits the small door at the shaftÃ­s base.
(N) PHELPS dashes onto the Charles Bridge and heads across the river, toward the Embassy. He throws a look back, over his shoulder. ParanoiaÃ­s setting in.
(S) EXT. EMBASSY (AS SEEN FROM CHARLES BRIDGE) - NIGHT
(N) Outside the Embassy, GOLITSYN escapes, pushing through the service area door and racing past a DRUNKEN COUPLE who are in the midst of a loverÃ­s quarrel, in Russian.
(N) Pan past the embankment and onto the bridge where PHELPS is still racing to meet ETHAN. But he stops suddenly, as if hearing something and looks behind him, at the deepening gloom.
(N) ETHAN and SARAH hear PHELPÃ­S voice over the monitor.
(D) The package is in the open.
(D) Jim. Jim. HeÃ­s in the open.
(N) Seated in the getaway car, CLAIRE listens to JIM and ETHAN argue.
(D) No, damn it, no, I said ABORT!
(N) Outside the Embassy, SARAH and ETHAN argue.
(D) Sarah eye on the package. Jim, IÃ­m coming to you.
(D) Jim gave an abort, we should walk away.
(D) No, weÃ­re going to recover the disk, understand?! Now move!
(N) ETHAN takes off for the bridge, leaving SARAH to shadow GOLITSYN.
(N) HANNAH hurries toward the getaway vehicle.
(N) ETHAN moves to the bridge stairs.
(D) About two hundred yards from the bridge.
(D) TheyÃ­re covering this frequency, Ethan. Cut all radio communications. Repeat. Cut all radio communications.

(N) ETHAN continues to run toward the stairs to the bridge. Past CLAIRE who sits in the getaway car. He looks on his monitor and again sees PHELPSÃ­ POV. Only ominous silence. Phelps is looking back over his shoulder. The bridge is deserted.
(N) SARAH follows GOLITSYN as he hurries toward the shore, where a cobblestone promenade runs along the river. He disappears into the fog at the edge of the river.
(N) The point of view goes crazy for a moment, then over and down to a bloody hole in his own chest.
(N) His head rocks again, then goes over the side of the bridge and makes the long, hard fall into the river below. EXT. STAIRS TO BRIDGE - NIGHT
(N) He races up the rest of the stairs to the bridge but thereÃ­s no sign of PHELPS.
(N) ETHAN runs to the railing and looks down into the river but sees only dark, choppy waters below, now becoming obscured in the gathering fog.
(N) He turns and looks to the embankment. He can faintly see GOLITSYN, hurrying along the promenade. ETHAN gives chase.
(N) ETHAN runs towards the getaway car, reaching a vantage point on the top of the stairs, he can see CLAIREÃ­S outline, visible in the driverÃ­s seat. But as he descends the stairs --
(N) The force of the blast knocks ETHAN back.
(N) He watches the burning car in stunned silence for a moment, a stunned CROWD starts to gather.
(N) SARAH comes out of the fog near the riverbank and sees GOLITSYN again, slowing down. A MAN comes out of the fog an seems to ask GOLITSYN for a light.
(N) SARAH draws closer. Behind her, the DRUNKEN COUPLE seems to be hanging with her for some reason.

(N) SARAH is almost to GOLITSYN. Suddenly, the MAN in front of GOLITSYN pulls him towards him. Sensing something wrong, SARAH quickens her pace. The MAN is now hunched over GOLITSYN, facing away from SARAH, going through GOLITSYNÃ­s pockets.
(N) The figure finds what itÃ­s looking for -- the disk -- and takes it. SARAH comes closer --
(N) ETHAN races around the corner onto the embankment. He bursts out of the fog, just in time to see SARAH fall to her knees, over GOLITSYNÃ­s body. ETHAN sees the knife in her chest and GASPS.
(N) He pulls the knife out of SARAH, who is close to death. He looks at it -- it is a black Teflon knife with a serrated edge.
(N) SARAH goes still. ETHAN lays her down, turns the other body over and sees that it is GOLITSYN. He quickly begins rummaging through his pockets.
(N) ETHAN hear police sirens and sees...

(N) ETHAN unscrews the mouthpiece of a payphone receiver. HeÃ­s holding a flat piece of metal with six prongs on it, a modernist cockroach. He CLICKS the cockroach into the guts of the phoneÃ­s wiring, piercing it with its little prongs.
(N) He screws the mouthpiece back on, holds the phoneÃ­s tongue down for a second, releases it and listens. He has a dial tone. Now he punches in a fourteen digit number he knows by heart.
(N) After a moment, a FLAT VOICE comes on the other side.
(N) There is a long pause and then familiar voice comes on the line.
(D) My team. Claire, Jack, even Jim - - Hannah, maybe, I -- donÃ­t know KITTRIDGE (M) (O.S.) Are you damaged?
(D) They knew we were coming. GolitsynÃ­s dead too. The disk is gone.
(D) Do you read me? The list is in the open!
(D) Let's just bring you in safely, and then we'll worry about that, okay? Were you followed?
(N) ETHAN closes his eyes. KITTRIDGEÃ­S voice is strong and reassuring and he needs that right now.
(D) DonÃ­t think, be sure. Are you clean?
(D) Location green. One hour. IÃ­ll be there myself.
(D) Heard a lot about you, Hunt. DonÃ­t disappoint me.
(N) He hangs up. ETHAN does the same. He stares at the phone for a moment, thinking. He checks his watch.

(N) ETHAN steps out of the phone booth and starts down the street. Every face seems to be starring at him now, every sound is menacing. He pulls his coat in tight, shoves his hands in his pockets and walks among the crowd.
(N) ETHAN makes his way past the old town clock, a towering, gothic structure and into a plaza, surrounded mostly by residential buildings.
(N) Straight across from him is a glass enclosed restaurant built on the portico of an old palace.
(N) Brilliantly lit up from inside, the restaurant positively shimmers, every table visible from everywhere in the plaza.
(N) ETHAN walks in the glass front doors, right next to an enormous fish tank, part of the restaurant's exterior wall. He scans the clientele carefully -- maybe a dozen PATRONS are scattered around.
(N) He spots a stack of documents on the table.
(N) ETHAN picks them up. There's a Canadian picture bearing ETHAN photo and the name Phillipe Doucette, credit cards, driver's license, etc.
(D) Passport, visas - you know the drill. We'll work the exfiltration thru Canada, debrief you at Langley. Throw the Prague police a bone, you know toss them a few suspects. Follow me?
(D) We've lost enough agents for one night.
(D) You mean I've lost enough agents for one night.
(N) KITTRIDGE seems to be at the point of saying one thing, then, carefully: KITTRIDGE You seem hell bent on blaming yourself, Ethan.
(D) Of IMF agents. At the Embassy. Tonight.

(D) Let's see if you can follow me around this room. (M) (eyes moving around the room) The drunk Russians on the embankment at 7 and 8 o'clock...The couple waltzing around me at the Embassy at 9 and 11. The waiter behind Hannah at the top of the staircase - Bowtie, 12 o'clock. The other IMF team. You're worried about me. Why?
(D) (M) (a tight little smile) You're right. Maybe this'll save some time.
(N) The figures around the room have grown restless. KITTRIDGE tries to indicate that it's okay. He pulls some papers out of his jacket.
(D) For a little over two years now we've been spotting serious blowback in IMF operations. We have a penetration. The other day we decoded a message on the Internet from a Czech we know as "Max."

(D) That's right. Max, it seems, has two unique gifts -- a capacity for anonymity and for corrupting susceptible agents. This time he's gotten to someone on the inside - he's put himself in a position to buy our NOC list. An operation he referred to as "Job 314". The job he thought Golitsyn was doing tonight.
(D) But the list Golitsyn stole was a decoy.
(D) Correct the actual list is safe at Langley. "Golitsyn" was a lightning rod, one of ours.
(D) This whole operation was a molehunt.
